conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B, analyze the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, determined by the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Identify the velocity-time graph for object B as the curve labeled B.
The slope of a velocity-time graph gives the acceleration.
At time t = 0, the slope is negative, indicating negative acceleration.
As time progresses towards t1, the slope becomes less negative and approaches zero, indicating decreasing acceleration.
At t1, the slope is approximately zero, indicating zero acceleration.
After t1, the slope becomes positive and increases, indicating increasing positive acceleration.
From t = 0 to t1, acceleration decreases from negative to zero.
From t1 to t2, acceleration increases from zero to positive.
The acceleration of object B first decreases to zero and then increases.
